InterSystems Documentation

Static Documentation Set

You have reached this page because the Caché online documentation database is currently inaccessible. The events that most commonly lead to this condition are:

  1. There was an error during the installation that interfered with the documentation database being placed on the system.
  2. The individual installing Caché chose to omit the documentation from the contents.
  3. The documentation database has been installed properly but is now dismounted, possibly deleted.

There are two documents that are likely to be most helpful at this point:

  • Installation covers issues related to properly adding Caché to your system and configuring it for use. The document is available in English or Japanese.
  • System Administration addresses the topics of starting a Caché instance, managing it while it runs, and stopping its operation. It too is available in both English or Japanese.

Other materials referenced here are intended to address less frequently occurring conditions. They are only a small portion of the available InterSystems documentation and are not intended to be complete. Rather, what is here applies only to what you need to get Caché installed and operational. If you are an Ensemble user, successfully starting Caché is a necessary step in bringing Ensemble online.

Once the system is properly installed and running and the documentation database mounted, the full set of InterSystems documentation is available from the online database, if it has been installed. Select Documentation from the cube or the program start menu.

Depending on the options used to install the system, documentation may be available at one or more of the following locations:

  • Caché
    • English
    • Japanese
  • Ensemble
    • English
    • Japanese
